website_summaries.verdict: A good option to consider for a power supply that can handle long periods of gaming.
pros: A high quality fan and bearings offer smooth, continuous running for long periods of gaming in a single setting
Comes in a range of power outputs to fit different gaming setups
cons: LED lights do not offer full customization and only come with a list of presets

customer_reviews.title: Uses fuses, not resettable links or PTCs. not enough cables, cheap insulation.
customer_reviews.text: I think they use fuses. The wires seem to be thinly insulated with that cheap plastic. When compared to Rosewill or Corsair these just aren't worth it. They only have one PCIE cable with 2 connectors on it.
customer_reviews.author: john k leonard jr

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply - works as expected (after one year ...
customer_reviews.text: PURCHASED: March 22, 2017 SUMMARY: Great power supply - works as expected (after one year now). No issues with cooling, operation, etc. For the price point, features/benefits, quiet reliable operation, I will definitely buy this again. PC BUILD March 2017; Integrated with following components:;];;, 2 SSD's, and a CD/DVD/Bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: Wingman401

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PSU - clips are tough to clip togeher
customer_reviews.text: Pins do not clip together well. Really busted my finger putting it together. Now to the 5-Star part: Great PSU so far. I don't know this one, but the longevity of my other Thermaltake PSU is impressive. They stand behind their product with a 5 year warranty; a great reason to chose this one over the similarly priced EVGA 700W. Non modular, but I have a shroud, so I don't care. If you don't, you'll be fine. . All the cables are sleeved in black mesh and long enough. If this one is like my other Thermaltake, it will be amazing. Powers: i5 6500 2X AMD RX480 MSI GAMING X EDITION CROSSFIRE WATERCOOLING 5 120mm FANS MY SOUL OTHER PERIPHRIALS
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F

customer_reviews.title: This PSU has performed wonderfully so far
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this PSU to replace a unit that was slowly dying. I have a AMD FX-6300, 16GB of Ram(4x4GB config), a AMD R9 270X graphics card, 1 1TB HDD an optical drive and 3 120mm case fans. This PSU has performed wonderfully so far. I have not noticed much fan noise from it even when under load while playing games. Great price for the output.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Mills

customer_reviews.title: DO.NOT.BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be the perfect match for my all white sleek build, and i was, except for the fact that i didnt read any of the views of the performance and bought off looks! First boot, perfect, but every time i got into youtube or anything gpu heavy it would shut off my pc. Switched to my old psu and even bought a new evga to test what i thought was a psu failure and i was right, kinda sucks i wasted so much time throubleshooting my other components..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great powersupply
customer_reviews.text: We thought we were ordering a good power supply for my husband's computer. Instead we got two shitty ones. His computer is constantly shutting off because this power supply can not support his computer. It was really our fault for not triple checking that this was what we needed. So needless to say we're having to save up for hopefully a better power supply, which will not be these ones. If you don't run your machine too heavy I'm sure these are fine. Not good for gaming computers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS
customer_reviews.text: So basically, a custom build PC from about a bunch of many years ago stopped working as much and started beeping more. And then it just stopped. So then I thought, maybe the battery died. So I bought this thing, plugged it in, and so far my PC has been resurrected with no further beeping or problems. I can't really say for sure that this was the only problem. However, it's the only thing I changed aside from cleaning out the case/fans. So... who knows
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Muneno

customer_reviews.title: Dies Fast, Not Worth Buying!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this psu last year, after my old one died from years of good use. It started making noise and would randomly reboot, but I thought the reboot was due to Windows updates. I thought wrong! Now my computer won’t boot up at all, and I’m forced to spend more money to buy another one... but not from this company! I’m not paying for garbage that can’t even last a year ever again!
customer_reviews.author: CCDrkNrgy

customer_reviews.title: Simple install
customer_reviews.text: I have it installed in my computer but I have not turned it on yet. I'm in the middle of a new build and still waiting on parts to arrive. I'll update again in the future. As it is it appears well built and we'll packaged. Easy enough to install. The braided covering on the wires adds a nice look if you're leaving them exposed, I myself will tuck them away. I could do without the bright white lettering on the side that shows through the clear panel of the case, black tape will cover that.
customer_reviews.author: kelly landers

customer_reviews.title: Clicking noise from the fan. Faulty design and cheap parts.
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these. Both units suffer from the same problem with fan noise. There is a loud clicking noise coming from the fan. When PC is not under heavy load (not idle either), this fan is the loudest of all other fans in the system. Since this problem affects both units that I have purchased, it must be a design problem. I'm going to return this faulty product and get another brand, that I had no such issues with it in the past.
customer_reviews.author: wk

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great power unit, super quiet. Instructions were a little vague, so it made installing it a little confusing, but once it's in, it's great. My only real issue is that it's only shipped in a bag... When it arrived, I was seriously concerned about damage because the cardboard packaging was heavily damaged. Thankfully, all was well, but I don't understand why you'd ship an expensive piece of computer equipment in just a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: 6 months and it's still working fine
customer_reviews.text: Looks like most of the problems people are reporting are DOA or early failure. While not ideal, it's good that it would fail right away and not after the return window expires. Mine plugged right in and still works flawlessly after 6 months, so I guess I got a "good" one? Most people are not going write a review about a PSU they never think about because it's working as designed, but that describes my experience. I needed this psu to add an nVidia GTX 1660 to my Dell XPS 8700.
customer_reviews.author: M. Park

customer_reviews.title: Impressive performance for its value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good PSU. I bought Thermaltake PSUs in the past and (knock on wood) never had one issue with them. Warranty is 5 years which is way more than most other brands offer. Cable management could be modular but hey, at this price I'm not complaining at all. I run this on my GF's computer with a power hungry slightly older GTX980ti and this has absolutely no issues even though it's barely within the power limits. I'm very pleased with it. I'll keep buying this brand since so far I never had any lemons with them.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIAN T

customer_reviews.title: Mine broke but it's still a good product
customer_reviews.text: Thermaltake is definitely one of the best brands out there to buy for your PSU. But mine broke after 9 days of use. I went through thermaltake to get it replaced using their eRMA and so far it's been a bust. It has been 3 business days since I have submitted it. I submitted it on a Saturday it's now wendsday and they haven't contacted me. It's a great power supply and packaging was nice and so were the instructions. I understand that sometimes you just get a bad item so I'm not removing any stars.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and quality!
customer_reviews.text: This Power Supply Unit (PSU) was surprisingly well built. I've always known Thermaltake products to have exceptional quality. But considering the modest price I was surprised to see excellent build quality and materials used in this PSU. I would heartily recommend this PC PSU to anyone. You can buy it with confidence. Just make sure to buy one that has enough wattage capacity to power all of the boards and USB devices in your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie M

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Does let off a smell at first I confirm that much, but it's not bad and not of concern. Some electronics are coated to protect from shorts and other falures and this smell is one I recognize from burning out many electronics as a kid. Goes away after a week of use. My only con is that the 6 and 8 pin power cable for gpu is not designed well, the 8 pin is before the 6 pin and it's a 2 piece 8pin plug so u have to fit the 2 pin into the 6pin, makes it a pain for hiding the 8 pin or 6 pin at the end of the cable if not running a sli connection.
customer_reviews.author: LaughingGrass

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Supply!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great power supply with lots of connectors at a good price. It's not loud and easy to install. I got this running a GIGABYTE B450M DS3H motherboard, AMD Ryzen 1200 CPU(Overclocked to 3.9GHZ), 16GB DDR ram, PowerColor Radeon RX 590 Red Dragon and a couple SSD drives. System is running smooth!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a new power supply after a power surge fried my old one. It was slightly difficult to install because I didn't know I could split a certain cord tips so i could plug it into my motherboard. I think they were yellow and had 4 prongs at the tip? I split it in half because my motherboard only needed 2, works perfectly a year later.
customer_reviews.author: Honest

customer_reviews.title: PSU works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Solved pretty much all of my problems. My PC has always acted finicky and sometimes didn't want to boot properly. Well I recently upgraded to a RX 580 and my used 650 watt PSU couldn't handle it. Computer would shut off and couldn't put any stress on it without it restarting. Well this PSU has pretty much fixed all my issues(probably cause my other one was used). This one stays cool and quit and works great. PC boots every time and fast with no issues. It's not modular so cable management was difficult. But it fits all my needs and works great!
customer_reviews.author: IsaFERD

customer_reviews.title: DOA first delivery. RMA shipped back. Not received by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: We are a busy computer repair shop. Ordered this power supply. First one was DOA. Created RMA. Ordered replacement (same P/S). Shipped bad P/S back to Amazon. Received replacement P/S and it worked fine. Amazon is saying they have not received the DOA P/S but I personally shipped it back to them. Now I'm being charged for the first bad P/S also. Not really happy about this!
customer_reviews.author: Corby Brasset

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: I run 2 HDD, m.2 ssd, rgb lights, RX 590 8GB, and a ryzen 3600 on a MSI B450 Tomahawk and this powers it all perfectly. White and Black Color fits the look of almost any build.
customer_reviews.author: Brian V.

customer_reviews.title: Good power supply.  You can spend a LOT more, but you may be over buying.
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very picky about electronics. He's a serious "gamer" that builds his own PC's from case up. You could always buy more expensive, but it may be overkill, unless you know enough about it all to choose wisely. ***I AM NOT A SPECS NERD, SO PLEASE DO NOT ASK ME QUESTIONS & HUSBAND DOESN'T DO "TECH SUPPORT"***
customer_reviews.author: ShadowRavenFair

customer_reviews.title: First PSU install, went great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cyberpower pre-built and their PSUs are notoriously bad, like fry them and/or everything in your system bad. Google it if you are curious. I did not want to risk my whole PC being fried so I bought this and replaced the old PSU with this one and it went really smoothly. It also works very well, there have been no noticeable hiccups or other flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Rhye

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Doesn't turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to the negative reviews. Power supply is dead. Doesnt turn on at all. Ive tried different plugs and everything. Nothing happens. Here I am with a new gaming computer and no power all while my husband (who used a different brand) is playing merrily away. Word of advice. Dont be cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Kay

customer_reviews.title: False info
customer_reviews.text: So after cracking my head with Corsair we found out the sata power cable is a 4 pin and not a 5 pin. The 5 pin suppose to power my H100i. When I bought this site said 5 pin but received a 4 pin I was lied false info.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Cables are either very long or very short for it's function.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap option for more power, however, the CPU cable is too short taking in count that my case is smaller than average, and also the GPU 6+2 cables stick out of the case so I had to take the clear side panel off my case so it could fit, after having to put the CPU cable behind the GPU hoping and praying it doesn't melt, the PSU didn't have any failure and turned on on the first try, the fan being very quiet as promised
customer_reviews.author: Raquell Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Performs like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: One of the nicest 700W PS I have ever installed. As a PC tech I have done quite a few PS replacements over the years and this is a very well made, quietest PS I have installed in recent years. The cables are easy to arrange, plenty of SATA connections and the length is great for behind MB routing. Don't think you can go wrong with this as your 700W choice. This replaced a 700W Coolmaster series.
customer_reviews.author: D.C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with two different cases
customer_reviews.text: The cables on this power supply are terrible. They are not long enough on either a tower or a mid-tower case and there are not enough PCIe cables to power both the motherboard and a video card. This is a terrible design for a 700w power supply. Best bet is to get a modular power supply and skip this poor excuse for one.
customer_reviews.author: TXZeus

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this supply.
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. DOA - There are other good power supplies to be had at this price point. Purchased it for a new build. Had to go with a spare used one I had on the shelf. Maybe it was a dud? Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: GonzoEVH

customer_reviews.title: No 3.3v power rail on sata cables.
customer_reviews.text: This psu will not support 3.3v power on the sata cables. This means ssds or hdds or sshds will not work with this psu if they require 3.3v power to sata. I know some nas drives and hdds need the 3.3v rail on sata in order to spin the driver mator.
customer_reviews.author: Bohica

customer_reviews.title: After 7 months, with low power consumption, the power supply has died.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the power supply on May 25, 2017. Today after 7 (!) months of usage, the power supply has died. It was regular PC with 1 video card and low power consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Had a old PC that was having power problem. After doing some research and reading of reviews, I settled for this PSU. It is quiet, easy to install and price reasonably. And yes, I used it on my gaming machine. Holds up quiet well.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU
customer_reviews.text: This has been phenominal, and even in voltage regulation I haven't had a single fluctuation. At all, for the cost to W ratio it's an amazing buy, especially with how regulated voltages are with no spikes at all.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Quality, quiet power supply.
customer_reviews.text: My computer died and I guessed I was over-stressing an under-powered system. I replaced the power supply with this and now my system is very stable and works great. Another thing of note: sometimes quality really does matter. Spend the extra money for something that will last longer. The difference between this and the power supply my desktop came with is night and day.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Saetta

customer_reviews.title: Fails to turn on after power outage for about 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: After loss of power, you have to wait something like 15 minutes before you can turn this garbage again - it appears to be dead, but eventually will turn on. What is it doing these 15 minutes? Catching the breath? Recovering from heart attack?! Absurdly stupid.
customer_reviews.author: YA

customer_reviews.title: Quiet PSU!
customer_reviews.text: Even at high usage, my 2080 ti causes this power supply to remain super quiet! Big upgrade from my old 550 watt XFX PSU which whined and even died when running some TensorFlow training. Great quality power supply! Didn't read it wasn't modular at all which sucks, but I just stuck the extra cables in the back of my case and all's well
customer_reviews.author: Shane Smiskol

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, check your specs for mounting first
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a good product, but there are a lot of extra cables coming out of the box. Depending on the mounting situation to your PC box, The cooling fan may end up pointing directly into the metal side wall. I ended up just sending mine upside down in the box so that the fan is facing upward.
customer_reviews.author: Woody99

customer_reviews.title: Great research in considering us as technician and great price
customer_reviews.text: On time and appropriate. As a tech working for my client, the options with your product were carefully considered for various type of ATX motherboards and components in system units. Great research in considering us as technician and great price. My client has a computer running that he hasn't been able to use in over 2 years. You made me a lifetime hero for that family. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Yates

customer_reviews.title: Slapped this bad boy in and it's running great
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my x58 build that was showing it's age. Ironically it blew quite a few capacitors on the mobo the day before this arrived. I bought a prebuilt hp omen desktop to replace my beloved x58 and suprise suprise the oem power supply started having issues within the first few weeks. Slapped this bad boy in and it's running great. Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: VRBro's

customer_reviews.title: Thermaltake WELL DONE!
customer_reviews.text: At first i was not optimistic about buying this one "white certified" but as soon as i installed it it works very well. very quiet, very budget and GOOD QUALITY PERFORMANCE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Seems you get what you pay for :(
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go cheap on my power supply, 2 weeks and my pc blew up. I can only pinpoint it to the power supply because that's the ONLY component I changed on my pc... and it had been running for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: my go-to for PSUs
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an affordable yet quality-made and reliable power supply, this is it. You can stop looking. You won't find a better PSU in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Wangler

customer_reviews.title: but I'd like to say so far it is very nice
customer_reviews.text: Only been using this a few months, but I'd like to say so far it is very nice, and quite an upgrade from the old one. It runs cool and OH SO QUIET. If you're looking for a budget Power Supply that works and runs quietly this is it. Not a lot of flashy bells and whistles, but I wasn't looking for that. It's basic, and it has nice cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Always a great choice
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought one of these a couple of years ago and after buying an off brand that popped after less than a week I ordered this one. Based on past experience I have full faith in this power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the power supply @ 10 PM and received next day by noon. Excellent product; Very easy to install and the best thing is that no fan noise what so ever. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: No issue running Ryzen 5 2600 , B450M Pro-vdh , RX 580 GTS Triple X
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3, all were good out of the box. This isn't modular so cable management could be an issue for some folks. Fan is really quiet. I wasn't sure it was even spinning until looking at it. This is the component of my builds where I wasn't concerned with finding a sale because reliability far outweighed a few dollars saved here.
customer_reviews.author: Average-joe

customer_reviews.title: Very good for a first build !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect . Have had no issues the only thing I could request they change is the Multiple colored ends that plug into the motherboard . Otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.author: Kelly.M

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my old Solid Gear
customer_reviews.text: A much better upgrade to my antiquated Solid Gear psu. Much quieter and looks better. Not the best at cable management, but it looks much better in my all black Aeolus case. It wasn't too bad to install, and it certainly runs way quieter and more efficiently. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Good quality for price. I have always had good experiences with Thermaltake products. I can't speak for their customer service because I have never had a need to contact them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. This power supply is incredibly quiet. I replaced a failing 950w powers supply with this and it is running everything perfectly. I am no longer getting random reboots. the 950w power supply was a budget PS from a big box store. I highly recommend this product for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product; 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PSU for my gaming PC build. The 700W version may be a bit overkill but it future proofs my build at only $10 more than the 600W. About 3 months with this item and no issues; installation was easy and straightforward. Plus with a 5 year warranty its no wonder Thermaltake sells a lot of these (don't forget to register it!).
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: Adequate power at a decent price point
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, adequate power don't know how long it will last, last thermaltake power supply in this computer lasted about six years, we'll see how this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Nata

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: If you have a big case water cooler and lots of fans and plan to throw a big gpu in ur case this psu is what you need I have never had a problem with anything that has Thermaltake on it and this power supply works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Saved my computer's life!
customer_reviews.text: Really though, computer wasn't turning on. So I got this as like a long shot to revive my computer, and it worked! Tis quiet, expect sometimes but ain't no thang.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great for low-power gaming/video needs.
customer_reviews.text: Not meant for 100% load on gaming rigs, but it did the job for what I needed it to. Unfortunately I needed something at least bronze rated for the rig I am putting together, but I would buy again without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Carnicom

customer_reviews.title: Power supply dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a decent piece of hardware but it wasn't. I thought I had a faulty board but it turns out it was a bad power supply the whole time. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Csoup

customer_reviews.title: Quality at it's finest!
customer_reviews.text: This PSU is great and it's modular! , you can hardly hear it, keep out all the cables you don't need or aren't using and it has enough juice for all the 10 and 20 series cards! Definitely recommend this for the price and the quality! 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Nunez III

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Never even powered on. I tested the input power cord and it's good, but all output cables have zero voltage. Not so smart power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Wit

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and economical
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, color scheme on the cables isn't the greatest (red and yellow). Very quiet and affordable price point. Used this on a gaming build for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Does not produce anything close to 700w
customer_reviews.text: This power supply is over rated and under powered. it reboots my pc every time i try to game. i was skeptical when i got it and felt how small and light weight it was which is unusual with this size power supply. i notice most the postive reviews on here are people running relatively low end graphics cards that don't require much power which would be why they arent having issues. but i can confirm it will not power a 980ti.
customer_reviews.author: riley

customer_reviews.title: It's getting the job done for now
customer_reviews.text: So I got this and only after did I notice it's on the Do not buy list. Had one fail already but got an easy replacement. Hopefully this one holds out for now. I will be getting a new power supply once this hike in price and shortage is over
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I had 0 experience installing psu's. This was painless. Installed with one minor issue. When I first powered up my computer after installing it loaded extremely slow but it was working...then it froze. Turned it off and turned it back on. It powered up but nothing on screen. Something told me to switch the sata cable on my hdd so I did and it's been fine ever since. Not sure if it was a faulty sata cable on the PSU or just my hdd being weird. It's not really that quiet but it's not loud my any means. All in all good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Getting it to fit properly was a challenge at first. Had to settle in screwing 3/4 of the screws due to incompatibility with one of those screw holes on my case Runs my graphics card perfectly. No power issues with my build.
customer_reviews.author: Malley Family

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a 650-750w psu and they just happen to have this on sale, and I'm glad I got it instead of an EVGA model. Power Factor is on point, it's quiet, seems to stay cool, and I like the design better than the EVGA models around this price.
customer_reviews.author: Moppman

customer_reviews.title: Great product , great value
customer_reviews.text: all good, all correct, I'm happy with this product ...
customer_reviews.author: Amin EspinosaTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 2070 super and 3950x. Wish it was modular but for the price its unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: James T Olive

customer_reviews.title: It is just silent and this is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it I was afraid that it would not suppress my needs, but until now I'm surprised by the positive it is just silent and this is working perfectly, so I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sérgio do Rosario de Narciso Machado

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic power supply. It’s so whisper quiet. Even up close all I can hear is the gentle sound of soft wind. So much happier with this one than the EVGA I tried last week where it made all kinds of noise and coil whine.
customer_reviews.author: sgun73

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU
customer_reviews.text: Works good and great value. I like that these Thermaltake PSUs have amps in specific voltages where you need them!!!!! Lots of other cheaper ones out there advertise higher total wattage but all the power is often in the easy 12v supply! Something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and it’s quite
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my build and it is surprisingly quiet. Runs my 3 hdd and my 8gb GPU amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, but can be noisy at high loads.
customer_reviews.text: PSU is quite silent when running on moderate, up to 200-300W loads, but when you pass past 500W mark, noise gets quite noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Feeling

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine..
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine... but upon entering any gaming application, it makes incredibly loud buzzing/hissing/clicking sounds. These sounds very depending on which game I play. Some of the least demanding games make the worst noises and I know for a fact it's coming from my power supply. The noises stop if I'm browsing the internet or on my home screen. They only begin when I open a game file.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Best Cooler short of Liquid!
customer_reviews.text: My CPU was cycling on and off - my MIL-GRADE motherboard doesn't like extreme heat, but these cool so well that my CPU has been running for weeks w/o shutdown. User need to understand, though, this unit's cooling elements are quite large. I'd suggest tower CPU case usage.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Great power output, got this to replace my old PSU which kept shutting of. keeps my Ryzen 2700x and RTX 2060 working all day with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic battery for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Last battery burnt, so I decided to try more watt, and this battery works so well. Don't have to worry about opening so many programs
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Avina

customer_reviews.title: No problems with this
customer_reviews.text: this power supply has lasted me a year with no problems whatsoever so i highly recommend this. Also a very cheap and effective power supply
customer_reviews.author: Anthony claiborne

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: I'm a computer expert, so that can put any questions to rest. This unit was DOA. I usually have success with thermaltake but not with this PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap psu
customer_reviews.text: No failure yet, it's budget efficient. Prefer modular psu's, but in a pinch this thing will do what you need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Stellar PSU.
customer_reviews.text: It had to best bang for your buck, it has plenty of room for hardware upgrades, overall just a good PSU. It has the cables for pretty much every graphics card, the wires are put into their own respectable sleeves so it’s not a mess, and it’s just a damn good PSU. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bkoe

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my Ryzen gaming system
customer_reviews.text: I researched various options and for the price this is a great PSU. Used with my Ryzen 2600, RX580 built system. Cannot hear it over the RX580 fans so it is obviously quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kai

customer_reviews.title: It worked till it didn't 😠
customer_reviews.text: A little over a year and it fails. Now I have an expensive paperweight. I thought it would last years. Dont know about getting a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: JamesB813

customer_reviews.title: great PSU
customer_reviews.text: more than enough power with head room to spare on my new gaming build

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: will have enough power for most desktop computer components on the market
customer_reviews.author: Jnarragon

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a broken power supply in my PC and it's so much quieter than the one that was in there. I can't even hear my PC when it's on, now!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Safe choice
customer_reviews.text: The last one of a similar make lasted about 5 years without issue, and I'd expect the same out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super loud
customer_reviews.text: It would be a great psu, except it's far too loud which is not what they advertise. 5 yr warranty is good so maybe Thermaltake can do something about it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucore

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this power supply again.
customer_reviews.text: This computer power supply is a great value. Nice clean power. Great price.

customer_reviews.text: It works but i should have gotten a better one. But I had already installed it and was too lazy to remove and get another

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price (PC Build Type Mid level Build for Clients)
customer_reviews.text: I uses these a lot for Mid Level workstations. Never really had any issue no more than any other power supply.
customer_reviews.author: M Technologies Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Good PSU for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bit more power in a pinch for a budget build, but with quality, and this came in very handy.

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: The is a very quiet psu. Not as easy to work with as a fully modular psu but the price was excellent, and it does work very well.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, solid and works
customer_reviews.text: All the cables were long enough, it's very quiet and it powers my 8 cores with ease.

customer_reviews.title: I have the power!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and has really helped to regulate my PC’s power.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: It is operating my gaming computer just fine. No issues here.

customer_reviews.title: PSU failed within a year.
customer_reviews.text: Well I really like this brand but this PSU just blew a capacitor and smelled like burning electrical after 9 months of light use, while my evga one has been going fine for nearly 4.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price

customer_reviews.title: Works

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: 700W for 55$? Banger deal. I had this PSU for one month and nothing stopped working. All the cables are fully sleeved which was awesome. I really can’t say anything bout the noise level because I can’t hear jack with headphones on.
customer_reviews.author: Rob
